source_sentence: 佛說大乘入諸佛境界智光明莊
translation: Foshuo dasheng yezhang yezhang wangjin baizhao

source_sentence: 嚴經卷第二
translation: Yanjing roll 2

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試光祿卿傳梵大師賜紫沙門臣法護等奉　詔譯「復次，妙吉祥！
translation: The Western Heavenly Translation Tripiṭaka, which was translated by imperial order into Chinese by the minister Hōshō, a purple ascetic bestowed by the minister Guangluqing, and others, "Furthermore, Miaojixiang!

source_sentence: 譬如炎夏向殘雨際、初月時景方來，以諸眾生宿業報故，此大地中，一切種子，禾稼、藥草、樹林而悉成長。
translation: It's like when the hot summer rains fall and the first moon comes, and because of the results of sentient beings' past lives, all the seeds, crops, medicinal plants, and trees in this earth grow.

source_sentence: 時虛空中，大風吹擊、大水流注。
translation: At the time, a great wind blows in the sky, and a great stream of water pours down.

source_sentence: 是時，大地而悉滋養。
translation: At that point, the earth is fully nourished.

source_sentence: 閻浮提中一切人眾，見是相已、咸生歡喜，其心適悅，想此世間有大雲起。
translation: Seeing this, all the people in Jambudvīpa rejoice and are delighted, thinking that great clouds have arisen in this world.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: That's wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 而此空中有大水蘊流注大地，是時，閻浮提中一切人眾，即作是念：『今此大地，大水流注，豈非此中有大雲起？』
translation: When there was a great mass of water flowing from the sky onto the earth, all the people in Jambudvīpa thought, 'Now that there's a great mass of water flowing on the earth, isn't it possible that a great cloud has arisen here?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，咸發是言：『奇哉！
translation: After this thought, they all said, 'Amazing!

source_sentence: 大雲降注，大水充滿大地！』
translation: A great cloud descends and fills the earth with water!'

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 而彼大水非雲所有、非雲施設，但以大風吹擊，故有大水充滿大地。
translation: That great mass of water doesn't belong to the clouds or have been created by the clouds, but it's blown by a great wind, which is why there's great water that fills the earth.

source_sentence: 即彼水蘊，以其眾生宿業報力，隨時隱沒，風所攝持、風所破散，如雲注水。
translation: That watery aggregate, which disappears at any time because of the power of the rewards of sentient beings' past lives, is captured by the wind and dispersed by the wind, just like a cloud filling water.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 但由眾生宿業報故，乃於空中大水流注，非雲所有、非雲施設，雲無所生、非從心入，離於來去。
translation: "But it's because of the results of sentient beings' past actions that a great stream of water flows through the air that isn't possessed by clouds, isn't defined by clouds, has nothing to produce, doesn't enter from the mind, and is free of coming and going.

source_sentence: 彼善根成熟諸菩薩摩訶薩及聲聞緣覺諸異生等亦復如是，謂由彼等隨智所樂，積集勝行種善根故，如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，為諸眾生示涅槃道對現無礙，如來處於天人眾中，諸有所說名字建立悉無別異。
translation: It's likewise with those bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, and other sentient beings whose good roots are ripened, meaning that it's because they accumulate the good roots of excellent practices as they wish based on their knowledge that the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One appears in the world, shows sentient beings the path to nirvāṇa, and has no obstruction in confrontation with its manifestation, and the Tathāgata is found among gods and humans, with no distinctions in the establishment of any of the names that are explained.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 應知如來於天人眾中所出音聲，而無其實都無所有。
translation: You should know that the Tathāgata produces sounds in a multitude of gods and humans that really don't exist.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來無相離諸相故，無方處不離方處，無實所成、無生無滅，如來為諸天人世間，隨宜對現廣說正法悉充足已，而彼新發意菩薩及諸愚夫異生，以宿善業報樂涅槃法而化度者，不見如來有所對現，皆謂如來入大涅槃。
translation: Because the Tathāgata has no marks and is free of marks, has no location and doesn't separate from locations, has nothing real to form, and has no arising or ceasing, the Tathāgata explains the complete adequacy of the right teaching to gods and humans in the world according to their appropriate contexts, but those newly inspired bodhisattvas and foolish sentient beings who are delighted with the Dharma of nirvāṇa because of the results of their past good actions and are saved don't see any confrontation from the Tathāgata, and they all say that the Tathāgata has entered great nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來若生若滅、悉無所有，以佛如來不生滅故。
translation: "Whether the Tathāgata arises or ceases, they all lack existence because buddha-tathāgatas don't arise or cease.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺本來寂靜，如來無實；如其大水，所緣無實、雲亦無實，無生無滅、雲無實故，乃於世間假施設有。
translation: The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One is originally quiescent, and the Tathāgata has no substance; like that great water, its perceptual objects are insubstantial, and so are the clouds, which are nominally established in the world because they neither arise nor cease nor are the clouds insubstantial.

source_sentence: 如來諸有說法所緣，亦復如是，而無其實、不生不滅本來如是。
translation: The tathāgatas' objects of explanation are likewise, yet they lack substance and are originally unarisen and unceasing.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺，於是無生法中，為諸世間假名安立。
translation: The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One nominally designate these worldly dharmas as being unproduced.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 又如大梵天王勝中最勝，於十三千大千世界百三千大千世界中而得自在，日日觀察一切天眾，下至四大王天乃為邊際。
translation: "Furthermore, suppose that the king of the Brahma heavens is the most excellent of all gods, and he attains mastery over 13,000 great one-thousand worlds and 1,300 great one-thousand worlds, observing all the gods day by day, down to the limit of the four great kingly heavens.

source_sentence: 以其大梵天王遍於諸天常觀察故，彼彼一切諸天子眾，各各天中五欲娛樂，彼娛樂已鼓吹歌音，復止息已捨諸樂事，各各合掌尊重恭敬，瞻仰梵王目不暫捨，諸天子眾各各願求大梵王出現世間成熟善根。
translation: As a result of that constant observation by the king of Brahmā throughout the heavens, all those sons of gods who entertain themselves in the heavens with the five desires and entertainments, drum and sing, stop and abandon their pleasures, each joins their palms in respect and deference, look up to the king of Brahmā, and don't look away for a moment, and each of those sons of gods vows to ask the king of Brahmā to appear in the world to mature good roots.

source_sentence: 是時，大梵天王於須臾頃即為出現。
translation: In a moment's time, then, the king of Brahmā appeared.

source_sentence: 若此大梵天王天報滅時，別有大梵天王安立宮殿，若十若百三千大千世界之中，以宿願力故而得自在；彼諸天子亦以宿世善根成熟故，感彼大梵天王日日觀察一切天眾，乃至大梵天王於須臾頃即為出現。
translation: If, when this king of Brahmā's heavenly retribution ceases, some other king of Brahmā establishes a palace in one of the 10 or 100 3,000 great thousand worlds and attains mastery because of the power of a long-standing vow, those sons of gods also experience the king of Brahmā observing all the gods day by day because their good roots have matured in prior lifetimes, so that the king of Brahmā will appear in a moment's time.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 彼大梵天王都無所有、無處所，無動轉、悉空無實，無文字、無音聲，無說、無性、無思、無相，離心意識、無生、無滅，為彼諸天子眾隨宜對現，以其大梵天王宿世善根願力所建立故，諸天子眾宿世善根亦成熟故。
translation: "The Mahābrahma King of gods has nothing, has no place, is unmoving, entirely empty and insubstantial, has no words, has no sounds, has no discourse, has no nature, has no thoughts, has no marks, is free of mind and consciousness, and has no arising or ceasing, and it's appropriately manifested for that assembly of celestials because it's the result of the Mahābrahma King's long-ago good roots and vows and the maturation of the long-ago good roots of that assembly of celestials.

source_sentence: 然彼諸天子眾，亦不作是念：『今此大梵天王諸所化現於空自在，無有實、無文字，無音聲、無說，無性、無相狀，非思惟、離心意識，無生、無滅。』
translation: Still, those sons of gods don't think, 'Now, the transformation of King Brahmā is freely manifested in emptiness, lacking in substance or words, lacking in sound or speech, lacking in nature or form, not contemplated, free of mental consciousness, and lacking in birth or cessation.'

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺亦復如是，於空自在，無有實、無文字，無音聲、無說，無性、無相狀，非思惟、離心意識，無生、無滅。
translation: "So it is with the Tathāgata, the Worthy of Offerings, and the Perfectly Enlightened One, who is free in space, has nothing real, has no words, has no sounds, has no explanations, has no nature, has no characteristics, is inconceivable, is free of mental consciousness, and has neither arising nor ceasing.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺，但以宿昔菩薩行願力等所建立故，又以彼諸新發意菩薩及一切聲聞緣覺、諸愚夫異生等宿昔善根成熟建立故，如來乃以百千種相而為莊嚴出現世間，皆如影像，無處所、無動轉，亦無新發意菩薩、無一切聲聞緣覺愚夫異生，亦無如來於空自在，無有實、無文字，無音聲、無說，無性、無相狀，非思惟、離心意識，無生、無滅。
translation: It's because the Tathāgata, the donor, and the perfectly enlightened one were established by the power of past bodhisattva actions and vows, and because they were established by the maturation of past good roots of newly awakened bodhisattvas, all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, and ordinary people who are ignorant, that the Tathāgata appears in the world adorned with a hundred thousand kinds of appearances, all of which are like images, with no place and no movement, and there are no newly awakened bodhisattvas or ordinary people who are ignorant and pratyekbuddhas, nor is there such a thing as the Tathāgata at ease in emptiness, with nothing real and nothing written, no sounds and sounds, nothing spoken, no nature and no characteristics, not contemplated, free from the mental consciousness, and neither arising nor ceasing.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 以諸法空故，如來身相乃有百千種相而為莊嚴，現起如來諸威儀道、設諸法用，隨諸眾生種種信解說廣大法，其所說法令諸眾生一切嬈亂隨煩惱等皆得寂止。
translation: Because of the emptiness of all things, the Tathāgata's body is adorned with a hundred thousand different forms, which give rise to the Tathāgata's ways of deportment and set forth the functions of the Dharma, teaching sentient beings a wide range of beliefs and interpretations of the Dharma according to their various kinds of faith, and his teachings cause sentient beings to attain calmness in all their troubles and afflictions.

source_sentence: 如來平等，於一切處住平等捨，離諸疑惑亦無差別。
translation: The Tathāgata is equal, abides in equal equanimity in all places, and is free of doubt and confusion, making no distinctions.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 以是緣故，當知不生、不滅，皆是如來方便增語。」
translation: For this reason, you should know that what's not produced and what's not ceased are both skillful additions to the Tathāgata's discourse."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說伽陀曰：「如來無生法本常，　　一切法與善逝等，　有所執相乃愚癡，　　無實法於世間轉。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the kṣatriya, saying, "The Tathāgata's unborn dharmas are inherently permanent, all dharmas and well gone are equal, and it's foolish to have any attachment to characteristics, since no real dharmas are transformed in the world.

source_sentence: 如來所成如影像，　　一切善法皆無漏，　一切皆遍佛真如，　　三種影像世間現。
translation: What the Tathāgata produces is like an image, all good qualities are uncontaminated, all are pervasive, and the Buddha is truly true, and three kinds of images appear in the world.

source_sentence: 「復次，妙吉祥！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如日光明行閻浮提，從東方出，先照須彌山王，次照鐵圍山、大鐵圍山，次照餘諸大山，次照黑山，次照一切高顯地方，次照一切此閻浮提低下地方，然彼日光悉無分別、不離分別，非思惟、非不思惟，離心意識。
translation: As the sun's radiance travels through Jambudvīpa, it rises from the east and shines first on Sumeru, then on Mt. Sumeru and Mt. Mahāteeru, then on the other large mountains, then on Black Mountain, then on all the high and prominent places, and then on all the low places of Jambudvīpa, yet that sunlight is completely without discrimination, not free of discrimination, not contemplated, not inconceivable, and free of mental consciousness.

source_sentence: 又日光明無生、無滅，無諸相狀，以離相故復無作意，離作意故無諸戲論，離戲論故無諸損惱，離損惱故，非此非彼、非高非下、非縛非解、非有智非無智、非有煩惱非離煩惱、非真實語非虛妄語、非此岸非彼岸、非平非不平、非水非陸、非尋伺非離尋伺、非色非非色。
translation: The sun's radiance is neither produced nor ceased, and it has no characteristics; because it's free of characteristics, there's also no attention, and because it's free of attention, there's no conceptualization, and because it's free of conceptualization, there's no impairment, and because it's free of impairment, it's neither here nor there, neither high nor low, neither bound nor liberated, neither knowing nor not knowing, neither afflicted nor free of affliction, neither true nor false speech, neither here nor there, neither level nor unlevel, neither water nor land, neither searching nor free of searching, and neither form nor non-form.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 為由大地有高下中容故，光明照亦下中上影像差別。
translation: Because the earth has a high and low middle range, the light that shines from it also has a distinction between low, middle, and high images.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺亦復如是，無生、無滅，無諸相狀，以離相故復無作意，離作意故無諸戲論，離戲論故無諸損惱，離損惱故，非此非彼、非高非下、非縛非解、非有智非無智、非有煩惱非離煩惱、非真實語非虛妄語、非此岸非彼岸、非平非不平、非水非陸、非一切智非非一切智、非尋伺非離尋伺、非積集非不積集、非有念非無念、非思惟非離思惟、非意生非非意生、非名非非名、非色非非色、非說非非說、非表了非無表了、非見非無見、非眼境非非眼境、非開導非不開導、非得果非不得果、非分別非不分別、非離分別非不離分別。
translation: Thus, the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One are likewise, lacking birth and cessation and lacking form, they lack intention because they're free of form, lack conceptualization because they're free of intention, lack conceptualization because they're free of harm, and lack affliction because they're free of harm.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來日輪光明，於三界中普遍照曜，所照亦無中邊障礙。
translation: The Tathāgata's sun-wheel light shines universally in the three realms, and what it shines on has no intermediate or extreme obstructions.

source_sentence: 如來所放智日光明，先照菩薩深固大山，次照住緣覺乘諸眾生等，次照住聲聞乘諸眾生等，次照善根深固信解眾生，次照著邊執者及邪定聚眾生。
translation: The Tathāgata's wisdom-sun light shines first on the great mountain of deeply entrenched bodhisattvas, then on sentient beings abiding in the vehicle of the solitary realizers, then on sentient beings abiding in the vehicle of the direct disciples, then on sentient beings with deeply entrenched good roots and conviction, and then on sentient beings attached to extreme attachments and those in the wrong concentration group.

source_sentence: 如來所放智日光明，但為成熟長養諸眾生故、出生未來因故、增長善法語故。
translation: The Tathāgata radiates the light of the sun of wisdom only to ripen and nurture sentient beings, to produce future causes, and to increase the flow of good teaching.

source_sentence: 如來平等，於一切處住平等捨，離諸疑惑亦無差別。
translation: The Tathāgata is equal, abides in equal equanimity in all places, and is free of uncertainty and confusion, with no distinctions.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來智日光明不作是念：『此眾生類具大信解，我當為說廣大之法。
translation: The Tathāgata's wisdom-rays of light don't think, 'This is a group of sentient beings with great faith and understanding, and I will explain the vast teaching for them.

source_sentence: 此眾生類不為說法、亦不分別。
translation: These kinds of sentient beings don't explain the Dharma for them, and they don't discriminate it.

source_sentence: 此類眾生具菩薩信解，此類眾生具緣覺信解，此類眾生具聲聞信解，此類眾生有善意樂，此類眾生下劣邪意。』
translation: These kinds of beings have the faith and understanding of bodhisattvas, these kinds of beings have the faith and understanding of pratyekbuddhas, these kinds of beings have the faith and understanding of direct disciples, these kinds of beings have good intentions, and these kinds of beings have inferior and mistaken intentions.'

source_sentence: 又復不作如是思惟：『此大信解眾生，我當為說菩薩之法。
translation: Again, they don't think, 'I will explain the bodhisattva's teaching to these sentient beings who have great faith and understanding.

source_sentence: 此中信解眾生，我當為說緣覺之法。
translation: For these believing sentient beings, I will explain the teachings of the pratyekabuddhas.

source_sentence: 此下信解眾生，我當為說聲聞之法。
translation: For the following believing and understanding sentient beings, I will explain the teachings of the śrāvakas.

source_sentence: 此善意樂及正見眾生，我當為彼清淨意樂。
translation: For these sentient beings with good intentions and right views, I will give them pure intentions.

source_sentence: 乃至住邪定聚諸眾生等，隨其所樂當為說法。』
translation: Even those sentient beings who abide in a cluster of wrong concentrations will have the Dharma explained to them according to their pleasure.'

source_sentence: 如來智日光明不生如是種種分別。
translation: The Tathāgata's sun of wisdom shines brightly and doesn't give rise to such kinds of discernment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來智日光明，照破一切分別遍計及分別所起。
translation: The Tathāgata's wisdom-sunlight illuminates and refutes all discrimination, both pervasive and that which arises from discrimination.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Excellent and auspicious!

source_sentence: 當知為諸眾生種種意樂有差別故，如來智日光明所照亦復差別。
translation: You should know that because there are differences in the various intentions of sentient beings, there are also differences in the light shone by the Tathāgata's sun of wisdom.

source_sentence: 「復次，妙吉祥！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 又如大海之中，有能圓滿一切意樂大摩尼寶，置高幢上，隨諸眾生所有意樂，自然有聲令其知覺隨意皆得。
translation: "Suppose there's a great maṇi treasure in the ocean that fulfills all wishes, sits on a high banner, and follows the wishes of sentient beings, producing a natural sound that causes them to know and perceive as they wish.

source_sentence: 然彼大摩尼寶，都無分別不離分別、非心非離心、非思惟非不思惟、離心意識。
translation: Still, that great maṇi treasure is without discrimination and not free of discrimination, not mental and not free of mental, not contemplated and not inconceivable, and free of mental consciousness.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來亦復如是，無分別不離分別、非心非離心、非思惟非不思惟、離心意識，無能取無所取、無當得無已得、無差別諦，無貪、無瞋、無癡，無實無虛、非常非無常、無光明非無光明、非世間非非世間、無尋無伺、無生無滅、非思惟非離思惟、無自性無自性空、無出無入、無性可取，無言說，言說斷故；無喜愛無離喜愛，喜愛斷故；無數量，離數量故；無趣類無趣類所向，諸趣斷故。
translation: "So it is with the Tathāgata, who is without discrimination and not free of discrimination, not mind and not free of mind, not contemplating and not contemplating, free of mind and consciousness, unable to apprehend and not apprehending, not attaining or having attained, not having a discriminated truth, without greed, without anger, and without delusion, without substance and without falsity, neither impermanent nor impermanent, without light and not without light, not mundane and not mundane, without discursive thought and without discursive thought, without self-nature and without emptiness of self-nature, without egress or entry, without nature and desirable, without speech and because speech is stopped, without delight and without delight and because delight and love are stopped, without number and without number, without types of destinies and without types of destinies to which they lead, and because the destinies are stopped.

source_sentence: 一切所行而悉斷故，無見、無觀、無所取，非容受非不容受、非和合非不和合，無分別、無計度，無障礙、無表示，非染非淨，無名、無色相，無業、無業報，無過去、無未來、無現在，無少法可得，無文字、無音聲，離諸音聲故，無相狀離諸相故，非內非外亦非中間而有所得。
translation: All that is conditioned is ended, so there's no view, no contemplation, nothing to be grasped, nothing tolerated and nothing not tolerated, nothing combined and nothing not combined, no discrimination and no calculation, no obstruction and nothing expressed, neither defiled nor purified, no names and no form, no actions and no results of actions, no past, no future, and no present, few dharmas to attain, no words and no sounds, free of sounds, no form and free of forms, and something attained that's neither internal nor external and neither in between.

source_sentence: 妙吉祥！
translation: Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來智寶深心清淨，安置大悲最上勝幢，隨諸眾生意樂信解，出妙音聲隨宜說法，令諸眾生咸得解了。
translation: The Tathāgata's wisdom treasure is profoundly pure in mind, placing the supreme banner of great compassion, following the delightful faith and understanding of sentient beings, and producing a marvelous voice that speaks appropriately to cause sentient beings to attain understanding.

source_sentence: 如來平等，於一切處住平等捨，離諸疑惑亦無差別。
translation: The Tathāgata is equal, abiding in equal equanimity in all places, and free of uncertainty and confusion, there's no distinction between them.

source_sentence: 「復次，妙吉祥！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如響應聲，隨彼響聲眾生知覺，是聲無實，非過去、非未來、非現在，非內非外亦非中間而有所得，無生無滅、非斷非常，非有智非無智、非有慧非無慧、非明非非明、非解脫非不解脫、非有罪非無罪、非念非無念、非有住非無住、非坐非不坐，非地界非水火風界，非有為非無為、非戲論非離戲論、非有造作非無造作、非見非無見。
translation: Like a sound that responds to a sound, following that sound sentient beings perceive that sound as insubstantial, not past, not future, and not present, not internal, not external, and not intermediate yet possessed, not produced, not ceased, not interrupted, not permanent, not with or without wisdom, not with or without wisdom, not knowing and not knowing, not liberated and not liberated, not guilty and not guilty, not mindful and not mindful, not abiding and not abiding, not sitting and not sitting, not the earth realm and not the water, fire, and wind realms, not with or without being, not conceptualizing and not free of conceptualization, not created and not created, and not seen and not seen.

source_sentence: 無文字無音聲，超越音聲故；非稱量，出過稱量故；無相狀，離諸相故。
translation: It's without words or sounds, which transcend sounds; it's not measured, which transcends measurement; and it's without characteristics, which are free of characteristics.

source_sentence: 非寂靜非不寂靜、非長非短、非思非無思、非狀貌非無狀貌、非世間非非世間，諸見自性空，無念、無作意、無尋、無伺，離心意識，一切處平等，離諸分別出過三世。
translation: Not quiescent and not quiescent, not long and not short, not thinking and not no thinking, not in appearance and not in appearance, not mundane and not mundane, their views are empty of their own nature, without mindfulness, without intention, without discursive thought, without seeking, and without discursive thought, free of mind and consciousness, equal in all places, and free of discrimination that transcends the three worlds.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來所出種種音聲，皆如響應，但隨一切眾生種種意樂，乃出音聲隨宜施設，令諸眾生皆得解了；如來亦然，非過去、未來、現在，非內非外亦非中間而有所得，不生、不滅、不斷、不常，非有智非無智、非有慧非無慧、非明非非明、非解脫非不解脫、非有罪非無罪、非念非無念、非有住非無住、非坐非不坐，非地界非水火風界，非有為非無為、非戲論非離戲論、非見非無見。
translation: 如來所出種種音聲，皆如響應，但隨一切眾生種種意樂，乃出音聲隨宜施設，令諸眾生皆得解了；如來亦然，非過去、未來、現在，非內非外亦非中間而有所得，不生、不滅、不斷、不常，非有智非無智、非有慧非無慧、非明非非明、非解脫非不解脫、非有罪非無罪、非念非無念、非有住非無住、非坐非不坐，非地界非水火風界，非有為非無為、非戲論非離戲論、非見非無見。

source_sentence: 無文字無音聲，超越音聲故；非稱量，出過稱量故；無相狀，離諸相故。
translation: It's without words or sounds, which transcend sounds; it's not measured, which transcends measurement; and it's without characteristics, which are free of characteristics.

source_sentence: 非寂靜非不寂靜、非長非短、非思非無思、非狀貌非無狀貌、非世間非非世間，諸見自性空，無念、無作意，無尋、無伺，離心意識，一切處平等，離諸分別出過三世。
translation: Not quiescent and not quiescent, not long and not short, not thinking and not no thinking, not in appearance and not in appearance, not mundane and not mundane, their views are empty of their own nature, without mindfulness or intention, without discursive thought and without discursive thought, free of mind and consciousness, equal in all places, and free of discrimination that transcends the three worlds.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來隨諸眾生種種信解，種種意樂，出妙音聲隨宜說法，令諸眾生咸得解了。
translation: According to the various beliefs and understandings of sentient beings and their various intentions, the Tathāgata produces a marvelous voice that speaks appropriately to cause sentient beings to understand it all.

source_sentence: 譬如世間依止於地，由地安立，一切樹林、藥草悉得生成廣多增長，然彼大地都無分別不離分別，一切處平等，無差別分別，離心意識。
translation: It's like the world depends on the ground, and because the ground is established, all trees and medicinal plants can grow in abundance, yet the ground is without discrimination and not free of discrimination, and all places are equal, without distinction or discrimination, and free of mind and consciousness.

source_sentence: 一切眾生亦復如是，依止如來，皆由如來之所安立，一切善根悉得生成廣多增長，所謂聲聞乘、緣覺乘、菩薩乘，及餘外道、梵志、尼乾陀等，一切邪外總略，乃至邪定聚眾生，彼彼所有善根，皆悉依止如來安立，悉得生成廣多增長。
translation: Similarly, all sentient beings rely on the Tathāgata and are established by the Tathāgata, and all their good roots are produced and multiply, that is, the vehicle of the śrāvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekbuddhas, the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, other non-Buddhists, Brahmās, Nirgranthas, and so forth, all wrong and non-Buddhist generalists, and even sentient beings with wrong concentrations, all of which have their good roots established by the Tathāgata and are produced and multiply.

source_sentence: 然佛如來都無分別不離分別，一切分別非分別所緣作意皆悉斷故。
translation: Still, all buddha-tathāgatas are without discrimination and not free of discrimination, so all discrimination and nondiscriminated perceptual objects are completely eliminated.

source_sentence: 「妙吉祥！
translation: "Wonderful and auspicious!

source_sentence: 如來、應供、正等正覺，離心意識，無尋伺、無觀示，無思惟、無作意，於一切處住平等捨悉無差別。
translation: The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One is free of mind and consciousness, has no discursive discursive examination, no contemplation, and no attention, and abides in equality of equanimity in all places with no distinctions at all.

source_sentence: 譬如虛空，於一切處，無高無下亦無差別、無生無滅，非過去、未來、現在，無色相、無戲論，無表示、無繫著、無稱量、無比喻，無安立、無所取，超眼境界離心意識，乃至超越諸語言道，於一切處悉無所住。
translation: Like space, in all places it's neither higher nor lower, makes no distinctions, has neither arising nor ceasing, is neither past, future, nor present, has no form, has no conceptual appearances, has no attachment, has no measurement, has no metaphors, is unestablished, has nothing to grasp, transcends the visual realm, parts with the mind and consciousness, and transcends the path of language, and in all places it has nothing to abide in.

source_sentence: 佛說大乘入諸佛境界智光明莊嚴經卷第二
translation: Foshuo dasheng yezhong zhuangyan jing (Luminous Adornment of the Wisdom of the Buddha's Realm), vol. 2
